description: SmallFoot is really starting to understand how the sizes attribute works and how it can be used. He decides that there should be a third, medium sized image for large phones and tablets. It should be used on screen that is at least 667 pixels wide. The large one on screens wider than 1024. (SmallFoot thinks mobile first, so use min-width again.)
todo: Adjust the media queries so birthday_medium.jpg is loaded when (min-width: 667px). Use birthday_large.jpg when (min-width: 1024px)

correct.headline: Excellent!
correct.text: SmallFoot is very happy now when he's managed to optimize the header image for different screen sizes!

wrong.headline: Not there yet...
wrong.text: Make sure you got the sizes attribute right. Also, double check that you didn't forget to add birthday_medium.jpg to the srcset!
